intro: Alangium longiflorum var. brachyanthum, commonly known as the narrow-flowered alangium, is a perennial shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are a key feature of its botanical profile. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional uses.
